Totaling thirty-four fascicles.
The daughter of Jiang Bi, the Academician of the Imperial University.
She renounced the world at a young age and was named Sengfa.
At the age of eight or nine,
Sometimes sitting quietly with closed eyes,
he recited the previous sÅ«tras.
The monks and laypeople of Yangzhou all called it divinely bestowed.
Changfang said:
Examining the sÅ«tras and Å›Ästras, this principle is clear.
It comes from past habits, not from divine bestowal.
Moreover, according to the classics, Confucius said:
One who is born knowing is a sage.
One who learns and knows is next.
This only discusses the present life and is confused about the past.
If it were not so, how could one distinguish the shallow and deep, past and present, sages and ordinary people of Buddhism and non-Buddhism?
Therefore, the Biographies of Eminent Monks says:
Shi Tanti
His secular surname was Kang.
His ancestors were from Kangju.
During the reign of Emperor Ling of the Han dynasty, they moved to China.
At the end of Emperor Xian's reign, during the chaos,
they settled in Wuxing.
Tanti's father Tong once served as the governor of Jizhou.
His mother Huang had a daytime dream in which she saw a monk
who called her mother and entrusted her with a yak-tail whisk and an iron bookend.
Huang slept and woke up, and saw that the two objects were still there.
She secretly found it strange.
She then became pregnant and gave birth to Tian.
When Tian was five years old,
his mother showed him the yak-tail whisk and other things.
Tian said, They were sent by the King of Qin.
His mother said,
Where did you put them?
He replied,
I don't remember.
At the age of ten, he left home.
He did not learn from a teacher, but his understanding arose from heaven.
This is the matter.
Later, he followed his father to Fan Deng.
He met the monk Sengfu from Guanzhong.
Suddenly, he called out to Fu, saying,
Why does the young boy call the elder by name?
Tian said,
The Venerable was originally the novice monk Tian.
Once, he was picking vegetables for the monks,
and was injured by a wild boar, and he unconsciously cried out.
Why have you forgotten now?
However, Sengfu was a disciple of the Dharma Master Hongjue.
He was picking vegetables for the monks and was injured by a wild boar.
Fu did not remember at first.
This was reported to Tian's father.
He told his father in detail about the origins of his birth.
And showed him the bookends, fly whisks, and other items.
Then he realized and wept, saying:
He was the disciple of Dharma Master Hongjue.
The master lectured on the sutra.
For Yao Chang, he lectured on the Lotus Sutra.
I was the chief lecturer.
Yao Chang gave the master two items.
They are now here.
Recalling the day Dharma Master Hongjue passed away.
It was precisely the day he entrusted the items.
Grieving over the incident of picking vegetables.
It only increased his sadness.
Later, Ti traveled and studied both internally and externally, recording whatever he encountered.
Later, he entered Huqiu Mountain Temple in Wu.
He lectured on the Book of Rites, the Spring and Autumn Annals, each seven times.
The Lotus Sutra, the Great Collection Sutra, and the Vimalakirti Sutra, each fifteen times.
He was also good at writing.
He had a collection in six scrolls that was widely circulated in the world.
He died at over sixty years old.
In the late years of the Yuanjia era of the Liu Song Dynasty.
Fang said:
The disciple of Dharma Master Hongjue, Seng Ji.
The master and disciple were famous guides in the three Qin regions.
What are the limits of the three robes and other belongings?
Only the bookends and whisk are cherished in the mind.
And when the consciousness is transferred and reborn,
These two objects are able to go together.
Even the material form of the spirit can still accompany each other,
How much more so the dharma of the mind's inner thoughts,
Which will not be forgotten.
Therefore, a mirror becomes brighter when polished,
A knife becomes sharper when sharpened,
Drops accumulate to form an ocean,
Dust accumulates to form a mountain.ğŸ”½Learning from life to life surpasses and increases,
Studying from birth to birth becomes more extensive.
It is like the moon at the beginning of the month,
Eventually becoming the full moon on the fifteenth day.
Abandoning the human body and receiving the human body again,
Is precisely the next life's affairs being remembered and not forgotten.
What is the spiritual power?
Closing the eyes and thinking quietly,
This is because women's feelings are weak,
Reciting in the dark and continuing,
Isn't this the recitation of the previous life?
As for discussing the bestowal of the spirit,
How can it be so foolish and ignorant of the way of wisdom?
